document.masterDocTitle: New taxonomic and faunistic data on Asian species of the genus Indenicmosoma Ardoin (Coleoptera: Tenebrionidae: Lagriinae), with description of a new species from Thailand

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New taxonomic and faunistic data on Asian species of the genus Indenicmosoma Ardoin (Coleoptera: Tenebrionidae: Lagriinae), with description of a new species from Thailand

bibRefCitation.author: Ardoin, P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ardoin, P. (1964) Contribution a l'etude du genre Enicmosoma Geb. (Col. Tenebrionidae). Entomologische Arbeiten aus dem Museum Frey, 15, 686 - 690.

bibRefCitation.author: Kaszab, Z.
bibRefCitation.refString: Kaszab, Z. (1970 a) Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Fauna Afghanistans. Casopis Moravskeho Musea, Vedy prirodni, Supplementum 54, 5 - 182, 23 pls.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Synonymy:
Indenicmosoma ardoini
described from Afghanistan was compared by Kaszab (1970a) with
I. indochinensis
,
I. nathani
and
I. pocsi
. In that paper
Indenicmosoma nathani
was said to be larger, with denser dorsal punctation, and with more convex pronotum. However, the examined type specimens of
I. ardoini
show no specific differences in the body length, in the shape of pronotum and elytra, in the dorsal punctation, as well as in the shape of the aedeagus with the above listed numerous specimens of
I. nathani
from India and Nepal ( Figs. 6–8 , 18–19 ). Thus,
I. ardoini Kaszab, 1970
is considered as a junior synonym of
I. nathani Ardoin, 1964
.
